ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The approval is to be interpreted as meaning that the message contained in the envelope is approved to be sent to the identified recipients.
There is an implied constraint on the business process that recipients cannot be added or removed after the approval is given.

An envelope may have associated with it a date sent, for which Date_or_date_time_assigment.role shall be given the value "Envelope sent". In the receiving system, an envelope may also have a reception date, for which Date_or_date_time_assigment.role shall be given the value "Envelope received".

This extends organization_or_person_in_organization_item to allow one or more recipients to be associated with the envelope. For a recipient, the organization_or_person_in_organization_assignment.role shall be given the value "Envelope recipient".
There are no properties predefined in this module. Property can be used to reference envelope properties such as encoding, however its use is subject to particular exchange agreements.

An Envelope provides an historical record of the transmission of a message. It is used to record the audit data for sending and acknowledging a Message. Because it is an historical record, each envelope is only used once, and so is not versioned.

The acknowledge attribute is used to ask for and provide acknowledgement of receipt of the envelope. On transmission of a message, acknowledge shall take one of the values "" (blank), "ask message arrival" or "ask message read". A blank value expects no reply. A value of "ask message arrival" asks if the message arrived at the recepients' mailbox, and requires the reply envelope to have values "acknowledge arrival" if the message arrives at the destination organization_or_person_in_organization, or "delivery failure" if failure of the delivery is detected. Envelope is used to provide an audit trail. There is no assumption that the transmission system has any knowledge of Envelope or its usage. However, if it reports some failure, this can then be recorded in the way described. A value of "ask message read" asks if the recipient has actually opened the Message to read it, and expects the reply "acknowledge read" on success, or "contents corrupt" if it is not possible to for it to be read. For any single Envelope, there should be an acknowledgement per recipient. The acknowledgement will not contain a Message. The Envelope being acknowledged is referenced using an Envelope_association.

An identifier for the Envelope. The id is used to identify which Envelope an acknowledgement is referring to. While this needs to be unique, the scope of uniqueness is problematic, since, for example, the scope may be all the NATO defence organisations and their suppliers.
This points to the Message that the Envelope is wrapping. A Message should be present unless the Envelope is being used to carry an acknowledgement.
This associates one Envelope with another. The most obvious use of the association is to link an Envelope to its acknowledgements.
This points to the related Envelope.
This points to the Envelope that the associating is relating to.

This may be used to define the role the relationship takes. If Envelope with id = 123 gets is acknowledged by Envelope id = 246, then Envelope_association.relating points to Envelope.id=123, Envelope_association.related points to Envelope.id=246 and Enveloped_association.role="acknowledges".
